Ain't Misbehavin' (musical).label: Ain't Misbehavin'
Ain't Misbehavin' (musical).description: Ain't Misbehavin' is a musical revue with a book by Murray Horwitz and Richard Maltby, Jr., and music by various composers and lyricists. It is named after the song by Fats Waller, "Ain't Misbehavin'". Wikipedia

Anyone Can Whistle.label: Anyone Can Whistle
Anyone Can Whistle.description: Anyone Can Whistle is a musical with a book by Arthur Laurents and music and lyrics by Stephen Sondheim. Wikipedia

Brigadoon.label: Brigadoon
Brigadoon.description: Brigadoon is a musical with a book and lyrics by Alan Jay Lerner and music by Frederick Loewe. Songs from the musical, such as "Almost Like Being in Love" have become standards. Wikipedia

City of Angels (musical).label: City of Angels
City of Angels (musical).description: City of Angels is a musical comedy with music by Cy Coleman, lyrics by David Zippel, and book by Larry Gelbart. Wikipedia

DuBarry Was a Lady.label: DuBarry Was a Lady
DuBarry Was a Lady.description: DuBarry Was a Lady is a Broadway musical, with music and lyrics by Cole Porter, and the book by Herbert Fields and B.G. DeSylva. The musical starred Bert Lahr, Ethel Merman and Betty Grable, and the song "Friendship" was one of the highlights. Wikipedia

Gigi (musical).label: Gigi
Gigi (musical).description: Gigi is a musical with a book and lyrics by Alan Jay Lerner and music by Frederick Loewe. It is based on the novella Gigi by Colette and 1958 hit musical film of the same name. Wikipedia

Hair (musical).label: Hair
Hair (musical).description: Hair The American Tribal Love-Rock Musical is a rock musical with a book and lyrics by James Rado and Gerome Ragni and music by Galt MacDermot. Wikipedia

I'd Rather Be Right.label: I'd Rather Be Right
I'd Rather Be Right.description: I'd Rather Be Right is a musical with a book by Moss Hart and George S. Kaufman, lyrics by Lorenz Hart, and music by Richard Rodgers. Wikipedia

Kristina från Duvemåla.label: Kristina från Duvemåla
Kristina från Duvemåla.description: Kristina från Duvemåla is a Swedish musical written by former ABBA members Björn Ulvaeus and Benny Andersson, based on a series of four novels by Swedish author Vilhelm Moberg detailing a family's ... Wikipedia

I Married an Angel.label: I Married an Angel
I Married an Angel.description: I Married An Angel is a musical comedy by Rodgers and Hart. It was adapted from a play by Hungarian playwright János Vaszary, entitled Angyalt Vettem Felesegul. Wikipedia

Lady in the Dark.label: Lady in the Dark
Lady in the Dark.description: Lady in the Dark is a musical with music by Kurt Weill, lyrics by Ira Gershwin and book and direction by Moss Hart. It was produced by Sam Harris. Wikipedia

Passion (musical).label: Passion
Passion (musical).description: Passion is a musical with music and lyrics by Stephen Sondheim and a book by James Lapine. The story was adapted from Ettore Scola's film Passione d'Amore. Wikipedia

Rose-Marie.label: Rose Marie
Rose-Marie.description: Rose Marie is an American actress. As a child performer she had a successful singing career as Baby Rose Marie. A veteran of vaudeville, Rose Marie's career includes film, records, theater, night clubs, and television. Wikipedia
Rose-Marie.Born: August 15, 1923 (age 90), New York City, New York, United States
Nominations: Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series
Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Performance in a Supporting Role by an ActressMore

Saturday Night (musical).label: Saturday Night
Saturday Night (musical).description: Saturday Night is a musical with music and lyrics by Stephen Sondheim, and the book by brothers Julius J. Epstein and Philip G. Epstein, based on their play, Front Porch in Flatbush. Wikipedia

The Beautiful Game (musical).label: The Beautiful Game
The Beautiful Game (musical).description: The Boys in the Photograph is a musical by Andrew Lloyd Webber and Ben Elton about a group of teenagers growing up during The Troubles in Belfast, Northern Ireland in 1969. Wikipedia

The King and I.label: The King and I
The King and I.description: The King and I is a musical, the fifth by the team of composer Richard Rodgers and dramatist Oscar Hammerstein II. Wikipedia
Adapted from: Anna and the King of Siam

The Music Man.label: The Music Man
The Music Man.description: The Music Man is a musical with book, music, and lyrics by Meredith Willson, based on a story by Willson and Franklin Lacey. Wikipedia

The Witches of Eastwick (musical).label: The Witches of Eastwick
The Witches of Eastwick (musical).description: The Witches of Eastwick is a 2000 musical based on the novel of the same name by John Updike. It was adapted by John Dempsey and Dana P. Rowe, directed by Eric Schaeffer, and produced by Cameron Mackintosh. Wikipedia

Hairspray (musical).label: Hairspray
Hairspray (musical).description: Hairspray is a musical with music by Marc Shaiman, lyrics by Scott Wittman and Shaiman and a book by Mark O'Donnell and Thomas Meehan, based on the 1988 John Waters film Hairspray. Wikipedia

Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dream.label: Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat
Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dream.description: Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat is a musical with lyrics by Tim Rice and music by Andrew Lloyd Webber. The story is based on the "coat of many colors" story of Joseph from the Bible's Book of Genesis. Wikipedia

Mack & Mabel.label: Mack & Mabel
Mack & Mabel.description: Mack & Mabel is a musical with a book by Michael Stewart and music and lyrics by Jerry Herman. The plot involves the tumultuous romantic relationship between Hollywood director Mack Sennett and Mabel Normand, who became one of his biggest stars. Wikipedia

Mamma Mia!.label: Mamma Mia!
Mamma Mia!.description: Mamma Mia! is a 2008 British musical/romantic comedy film adapted from the 1999 West End/2001 Broadway musical of the same name, based on the songs of successful pop group ABBA, with additional music composed by ABBA member Benny Andersson. Wikipedia
Featured songs: When All Is Said and Done
Lay All Your Love on Me
Awards: Razzie Award for Worst Supporting Actor

Metropolis (musical).label: Metropolis
Metropolis (musical).description: Metropolis is a musical based on the 1927 silent movie of the same name that was staged at the Piccadilly Theatre in London in 1989. The music was written by Joe Brooks, the lyrics by Dusty Hughes. The show was directed by Jérôme Savary. Wikipedia

Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet.label: Sweeney Todd The Demon Barber of Fleet Street
Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet.description: Unjustly sent to prison, a man vows revenge, not only for that cruel punishment, but for the devastating consequences of what happened to his wife and daughter. When he returns to reopen his barber shop, he becomes Sweeney Todd, the Demon Barber of Fleet Street, who "shaved the faces of gentlemen wh… Moreo never thereafter were heard of again." Sweeney's amorous accomplice, Mrs. Lovett, creates diabolical meat pies.
Adapted from: Sweeney Todd The Demon Barber of Fleet Street

The Producers (musical).label: The Producers
The Producers (musical).description: The Producers is a musical adapted by Mel Brooks and Thomas Meehan from Brooks' 1968 film of the same name, with lyrics written by Brooks and music composed by Brooks and arranged by Glen Kelly and Doug Besterman. Wikipedia

Urinetown.label: Urinetown
Urinetown.description: Urinetown The Musical is a satirical comedy musical from 2001, with music by Mark Hollmann, lyrics by Hollmann and Greg Kotis, and book by Kotis. Wikipedia

Abyssinia (musical).label: Abyssinia
Abyssinia (musical).description: Abyssinia is a musical with music by Ted Kociolek, lyrics by James Racheff, and a book by both Racheff and Kociolek, based on the novel Marked by Fire, by Joyce Carol Thomas. Wikipedia

Crazy for You (musical).label: Crazy for You
Crazy for You (musical).description: Crazy for You is a romantic love musical with a book by Ken Ludwig, lyrics by Ira Gershwin, and music by George Gershwin. Wikipedia

Daddy Cool (musical).label: Daddy Cool
Daddy Cool (musical).description:
Daddy Cool is a musical based upon the works of Boney M and other Frank Farian produced artists. It premiered in the West End in 2006, followed by UK and international tours.
The musical tells the story of Sunny, a young man who lives for his music. Wikipedia

Guys and Dolls.label: Guys and Dolls
Guys and Dolls.description: Guys and Dolls is a musical with music and lyrics by Frank Loesser and book by Jo Swerling and Abe Burrows. Wikipedia
Adapted from: The Idyll of Miss Sarah Brown

How to Succeed in Business Without Reall.label: How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying
How to Succeed in Business Without Reall.description:
{{Infobox Musical | name = How to Succeed in Business
Without Really Trying | image = How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying 1961 Original Cast Recording.jpg | image_size = 260px | caption = ... Wikipedia
Adaptations: How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying (1967)
How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying

Hoy No Me Puedo Levantar.label: Hoy No Me Puedo Levantar
Hoy No Me Puedo Levantar.description: Hoy no me puedo levantar is a Spanish jukebox musical, with music and lyrics by Jose Maria Cano and Nacho Cano, former members of the band Mecano. Wikipedia

Lord of the Rings (musical).label: Lord of the Rings
Lord of the Rings (musical).description: The Lord of the Rings is the most prominent of several theatre adaptations of J. R. R. Tolkien's epic high fantasy novel of the same name, set in his world of Middle-earth, including music by A. R. Wikipedia

Matilda the Musical.label: Matilda the Musical
Matilda the Musical.description: Matilda the Musical is a stage musical based on the children's novel of the same name by Roald Dahl. It was written by Dennis Kelly, with music and lyrics by Tim Minchin. Wikipedia

Me and Bessie.label: Me and Bessie
Me and Bessie.description: Me and Bessie is a musical revue about the life and career of blues singer Bessie Smith. The basically one-woman show, conceived and written by Will Holt and Linda Hopkins and performed by Hopkins, ... Wikipedia

Monkey: Journey to the West.label: Monkey Journey to the West
Monkey: Journey to the West.description: Monkey Journey to the West is a stage adaptation of the novel Journey to the West by Wu Cheng'en. It was conceived and created by the Chinese actor and director Chen Shi-zheng along with British musician ... Wikipedia

Park Avenue (musical).label: Park Avenue
Park Avenue (musical).description: Park Avenue is a musical with a book by George S. Kaufman and Nunnally Johnson, music by Arthur Schwartz and lyrics by Ira Gershwin. The plot focused on the many divorces and marriages of the rich and "black tie" set. Wikipedia

Rebecca (musical).label: Rebecca
Rebecca (musical).description: Rebecca is a German-language musical based on the novel of the same name by Daphne du Maurier. It was written by Michael Kunze and Sylvester Levay, the authors of the musicals Elisabeth, Mozart! and Marie Antoinette. Wikipedia

The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling B.label: The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee
The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling B.description: The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee is a long one-act musical comedy conceived by Rebecca Feldman with music and lyrics by William Finn, a book by Rachel Sheinkin and additional material by Jay Reiss. Wikipedia

The Book of Mormon (musical).label: The Book of Mormon
The Book of Mormon (musical).description: The Book of Mormon is a religious satire musical with book, lyrics, and music by Trey Parker, Robert Lopez, and Matt Stone. Wikipedia

The Last Five Years.label: The Last Five Years
The Last Five Years.description: The Last Five Years is a musical written by Jason Robert Brown. It premiered at Chicago's Northlight Theatre in 2001 and was then produced Off-Broadway in March 2002. Wikipedia

The Swing Mikado.label: The Swing Mikado
The Swing Mikado.description: The Swing Mikado is an operetta in two acts with music arranged by Gentry Warden, based on Gilbert and Sullivan's comic opera, The Mikado. Wikipedia

Wonderland (musical).label: Wonderland (musical)
Wonderland (musical).description: Wonderland A New Alice, formerly called Wonderland Alice's New Musical Adventure, is a musical with a book by Jack Murphy and Gregory Boyd, lyrics by Murphy, and music by Frank Wildhorn. Wikipedia

Zanna, Don't!.label: Zanna, Don't!
Zanna, Don't!.description: Zanna Don't! is a musical written by Tim Acito and with additional lyrics and material by Alexander Dinelaris. It has played in regional theatres, Off-Broadway and off-West End. Wikipedia

Dracula – Entre l'amour et la mort.label: Dracula – Entre l'amour et la mort
Dracula – Entre l'amour et la mort.description: Dracula – Entre l'amour et la mort is a Québécois musical created by Bruno Pelletier. Lyrics are written by Roger Tabra; music is by Simon Leclerc; the original concept is credited to Bruno Pelletier and Richard Ouzounian. Wikipedia

Jacques Brel is Alive and Well and Livin.label: Jacques Brel is Alive and Well and Living in Paris
Jacques Brel is Alive and Well and Livin.description: Jacques Brel Is Alive and Well and Living in Paris is an American musical revue of the songs of Jacques Brel. It was filmed in 1975. Wikipedia
Adaptations: Jacques Brel Is Alive and Well and Living in Paris (1974)

1600 Pennsylvania Avenue (musical).label: 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue
1600 Pennsylvania Avenue (musical).description: 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue is a 1976 musical with music by Leonard Bernstein and book and lyrics by Alan Jay Lerner. It is considered to be a legendary Broadway flop, running only seven performances. Wikipedia

A Family Affair (musical).label: A Family Affair
A Family Affair (musical).description: A Family Affair is a musical with a book by James Goldman and William Goldman, lyrics by James Goldman and John Kander, and music by Kander. This was Kander's first show, and his only one written without Fred Ebb. Wikipedia

Big: the musical.label: Big the musical
Big: the musical.description: Big the musical is a 1996 musical adaptation of the 1988 Tom Hanks film Big. It was directed by Mike Ockrent and featured music by David Shire and lyrics by Richard Maltby, Jr., with choreography by Susan Stroman. Wikipedia

Clue (musical).label: Clue
Clue (musical).description: Clue The Musical is a musical with a book by Peter DePietro, music by Galen Blum, Wayne Barker and Vinnie Martucci, and lyrics by Tom Chiodo, based on the board game Clue. Wikipedia

Dear Edwina.label: Dear Edwina
Dear Edwina.description: Dear Edwina is a musical by Zina Goldrich and Marcy Heisler. A children's one-hour musical, it concerns a young girl who gives her neighborhood friends and family advice through singing in a musical show. Wikipedia

Happy End (musical).label: Happy End
Happy End (musical).description: Happy End is a three-act musical comedy by Kurt Weill, Elisabeth Hauptmann, and Bertolt Brecht which first opened in Berlin at the Theater am Schiffbauerdamm on September 2, 1929. It closed after seven performances. Wikipedia

Let My People Come.label: Let My People Come
Let My People Come.description: Let My People Come is the title of an explicit musical about sex which ran from January 8, 1974 to July 5, 1976 in New York City, at The Village Gate in Greenwich Village, and which is now being revived ... Wikipedia

Lolita, My Love.label: Lolita, My Love
Lolita, My Love.description: Lolita, My Love was an unsuccessful musical by John Barry and Alan Jay Lerner, based on Vladimir Nabokov's novel Lolita. It closed in Boston in 1971 while on a tour prior to Broadway. Wikipedia

The Hot Mikado (1939 production).label: The Hot Mikado
The Hot Mikado (1939 production).description: The Hot Mikado was a 1939 musical theatre adaptation of Gilbert and Sullivan's The Mikado with an African-American cast. Wikipedia

Elegies for Angels, Punks and Raging Que.label: Elegies for Angels, Punks and Raging Queens
Elegies for Angels, Punks and Raging Que.description: Elegies For Angels, Punks and Raging Queens is a song cycle with music by Janet Hood and lyrics and additional text by Bill Russell. Wikipedia

Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark.label: Spider-Man Turn Off the Dark
Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark.description: Spider-Man Turn Off the Dark is a 2011 rock musical with music and lyrics by U2's Bono and The Edge and a book by Julie Taymor, Glen Berger, and Roberto Aguirre-Sacasa. Wikipedia

Olympus on My Mind.label: Olympus on My Mind
Olympus on My Mind.description: Olympus On My Mind is a musical with music by Grant Sturiale and a book and lyrics by Barry Harman, based on a play by Heinrich Von Kleist. The musical ran Off-Broadway at Lamb's Theatre for 297 performances in 1986. Wikipedia

The Real Ambassadors.label: The Real Ambassadors
The Real Ambassadors.description: The Real Ambassadors is a jazz musical developed in the late 1950s and early 1960s by Dave and Iola Brubeck, in collaboration with Louis Armstrong and his band. Wikipedia

Adding Machine (musical).label: Adding Machine
Adding Machine (musical).description: Adding Machine is a musical adaptation of Elmer Rice's 1923 play The Adding Machine, with music by Joshua Schmidt, and book and lyrics by Jason Loewith and Joshua Schmidt. The show opened in 2007 in Illinois before moving Off-Broadway in 2008. Wikipedia

Vanities, A New Musical.label: Vanities, A New Musical
Vanities, A New Musical.description: Vanities, A New Musical is a musical with music and lyrics by David Kirshenbaum and a book by Jack Heifner, based on the book and 1976 play of the same name. Wikipedia

And the World Goes 'Round.label: And the World Goes 'Round
And the World Goes 'Round.description: And the World Goes 'Round is a musical revue showcasing the songs of John Kander and Fred Ebb. The revue takes its title from a tune the songwriting team wrote for Liza Minnelli to sing in the film New York, New York Wikipedia

Birds of Paradise (musical).label: Birds of Paradise
Birds of Paradise (musical).description: Birds of Paradise is a musical with music by David Evans, lyrics by Winnie Holzman, and the book by Evans and Holzman. It had a brief run Off-Broadway in 1987. Wikipedia

Bernarda Alba (musical).label: Bernarda Alba
Bernarda Alba (musical).description: Bernarda Alba is a one-act musical with music, lyrics and book by Michael John LaChiusa, based on Federico García Lorca's 1936 play The House of Bernarda Alba. Wikipedia

Blondel (musical).label: Blondel
Blondel (musical).description: Blondel, a rock opera musical by Tim Rice and Stephen Oliver, was inspired by, and very loosely based on, the life of the eponymous French troubadour. The play is set during the period of the Third Crusade. Wikipedia

Boobs! The Musical.label: Boobs! The Musical
Boobs! The Musical.description: Boobs! The Musical The World According to Ruth Wallis is a musical revue with lyrics and music by 1950s and 1960s star Ruth Wallis. Wikipedia

Brownstone (musical).label: Brownstone
Brownstone (musical).description: Brownstone is a musical written by Josh Rubins, Andrew Cadiff and Peter Larson. It centers on a group of five people living in a brownstone apartment in New York City. Wikipedia

Diamonds (musical).label: Diamonds
Diamonds (musical).description: Diamonds is a musical revue about baseball. The book and music were created by many writers, composers, and lyricists. Among them were Roy Blount, Jr., and John Weidman, and Comden and Green, Howard Ashman, and Cy Coleman, music. Wikipedia
